citeinfo.title: Coastal Topography--Northeast Atlantic Coast, Post-Hurricane Sandy, 2012: Lidar and digital elevation model (DEM) tile index

descript.abstract: This data represents the tile index for lidar data collected for the U.S. Geological Survey in November 2012 following Hurricane Sandy, which made landfall in the eastern United States on October 29th, 2012. The lidar LAS and derived-digital elevation model (DEM) data are divided into these tiles and filenames match the tile number. The index shows the extent of data collection (portions of the coastline of New York, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, and North Carolina) and provides tile names to aid in identifying files for data download.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this project was to derive shoreline, dune crest (Dhigh), and dune toe (Dlow) of a portion of the New York, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, and North Carolina coastlines, post-Hurricane Sandy (October 2012 hurricane), for use as a management tool and to make these data available to natural-resource managers and research scientists.
descript.supplinf: The tile index follows U.S. National Grid (USSNG) reference map. More information on the USNG can be found here: http://www.fgdc.gov/usng

theme.themekey: DOI/USGS/CMG > COASTAL AND MARINE GEOLOGY, U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, U.S. DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR

idinfo.useconst: The U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service request to be acknowledged as originators of these data in future products or derivative research.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, St. Petersburg Coastal and Marine Science Center, St. Petersburg, FL

idinfo.datacred: Acknowledgment of the U.S. Geological Survey, St. Petersburg Coastal and Marine Science Center, as a data source would be appreciated in products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected. Sharing of new data layers developed directly from these data would also be appreciated by the U.S. Geological Survey staff. Users should be aware that comparisons with other datasets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in photointerpretation, mapping conventions, and digital processes over time. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

citeinfo.title: Coastal Topography--Northeast Atlantic Coast, Post-Hurricane Sandy, 2012: Lidar point-cloud data (LAS) AND Digital elevation model (DEM)
citeinfo.geoform: binary point cloud and remote sensing image
citeinfo.othercit: The Tile index data set provides reference information for identifying the spatial extent of lidar point-cloud files (LAS) and file names for data download.

attracc.attraccr: The project area required lidar to be collected on 1 meter ground sample distance (GSD) or better and processed to meet a bare earth vertical accuracy of 12.5 centimeters RMSEz or better.

dataqual.logic: The data was visually inspected by a GIS manager.
dataqual.complete: This Tile Index covers the data extent, which spans from Long Island, New York to Cape Hatteras, North Carolina. The state of New Jersey was collected using the EAARL-B sensor and that data will be published separately.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy of the tile index was not determined.

procstep.procdesc: Tile Size: 1,500m x 1,500m.The tile file name was derived from the southwest corner of each tile. The tiles are named based on the US National Grid.

enttyp.enttypd: Tile index showing the spatial extent and boundaries of lidar (LAS) and DEM data files

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Sequential unique whole number assigned to tiles (west-to-east, north-to-south) for identification.
Tile name described by US National Grid naming scheme.

attrdomv.udom: The first 2 numbers in the filename represent UTM zone.

attr.attrdef: Name of commercial agency that collected the data.

attrdomv.udom: Text string defining the name of the company who collected the lidar data (either Woolpert, Inc. or Photo Science, Inc.)

attr.attrdef: State in which the data are located.

attrdomv.udom: A text string defining the state name.

attr.attrdef: Web link to DEM data location.

attrdomv.udom: DEM data are available in the U.S. Geological Survey pubs warehouse

attr.attrdef: Web link to LAS data download location.

attrdomv.udom: LAS data are available in the U.S. Geological Survey pubs warehouse

attr.attrdef: Web link to dune feature data download location.

attrdomv.udom: Dune and shoreline data are available in the U.S. Geological Survey pubs warehouse
A text string that describes the date or date range in MM/DD/YYYY; where MM is the month, DD is the day, and YYYY is the year.

digtinfo.formspec: The lidar tile index (Lidar_Tile_Index.shp) is in ArcGIS shapefile format compressed into a zip file with metadata.
